question: how do I structure my week
plan for the week
time management
answer: The recommendation is that you should spend 40 hours a week on studying.  So on average it might be 8 hours a day.  You should try and do some basic exercises or LeetCode challenges for 30 minutes a day to hone your programming skills.  Vary the language you use.  Then split your day equally between online courses and project work.  This is only a guide though.  Why not talk to some of the second years and see what they do?

question: why did you join the course
why are you here
answer: I wanted a course that would help me get a remote working job and this course seemed to do that.  Half the first years had placements by the end of the first year, so I am hoping to have similar opportunities.

question: where do I start
where do I begin
answer: Try and work backwards from what you want to achieve.  If you are stuck why not reach out to the #21-22-Cohort or #general channels and ask for help?  You can also ask me if you need a quick resource.

question: who created you
answer: That's a bit personal. If you must know, I was created by Tom to help you with this course. Looking forward to working with you %you.first_name%.

question: what is the tag for a paragraph of text?
